result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

CONDITIONS:   No contact with V1 in Omro PD report #22-20.   No contact with any females under the age of 18 including step-daughter L.D.   Do not leave the State of Wisconsin.

10:12 AM Defendant ROBERT J. MYERS in court VIA ZOOM, in custody WINNEBAGO COUNTY JAIL.  Amanda Nash appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  SPD attempting to appoint counsel and has not been able to obtain; court adjourns arraignment to allow counsel to be present with defendant.  Defendant requests to be heard as to bond modification.  The Court did confirm with the State that they are in compliance with Marsy's Law.  Victims are opposed to reduction of bond and make statements to the court.  Court will appoint counsel for defendant.  Court increases bond amount with same conditions as previously ordered.  Defendant shall appear IN-PERSON for any future hearings with the court.  Arraignment scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 11:00 am.

12:00 AM Defendant ROBERT J. MYERS in court, in custody.  David C. Rashid appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  ROBERT J. MYERS appeared by video means.  The Public Defender is still looking for an attorney to take his case.  The DE wants to have this hearing without an attorney today.  Testimony taken.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed.  Defendant bound over for trial.  DE requests to address bond.  Told he needs to file that in writing due to Marsy's law.  Bond Continues.  Victim's Guardian addresses the Court.  Record closed @ 12:13.  Arraignment scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 10:00 am.
